RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUZZINGA KARMA dueled for the lead from the outside of ANDALEIGH entering the stretch the first time, opened a clear advantage in the run to the second turn, maintained a big lead in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, and held off a late surge by DESIRED OUTCOME to prevail. DESIRED OUTCOME stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, settled off the pacesetter in the run down the backside, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to prove easily second best. ANDALEIGH away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch, before easing off the pacesetter while saving ground in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ANZAC BAY away well and stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time, before settling off the pacesetter in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive. SHESBOURBONONICE broke sharply and was allowed to settled at the back of the pack in the run through the stretch the first time, trailed the field in the run down the backstretch, but failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Desired Outcome
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Anzac Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Shesbourbononice
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, trailed, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Andaleigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, settled inside, rallied 2 w, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzinga Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, clear lead, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Delta Colleen H. HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 98. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES & MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, September 2, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to se cond, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back.High weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determiningp reference of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INFINITE PATIENCE away alertly and raced to the lead three wide entering the first turn, and raced on an uncontested lead through the stretch the first time, turned back a bid by WANDALITA in the run to the final turn, opened a clear advantage through the turn, and was never seriously threatened late under confident handling. WE B THREE broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained a tracking trip from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, shifted off the rail for the drive, and closed willingly two wide in the drive but was unable to seriously threaten the winner late. WANDALITA away well, and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, forced the issue two out from the rail in the run to the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival entering the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to hold on for a share. NO PEOPLE settled off the early pace while trailing the field through the stretch the first time, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Wandalita
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: We B Three
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, track 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Infinite Patience
ENTRY.OWNER: Decoursey William and R N H Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led inside, rallied 2 wide, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MILITARY CROSS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, sprinted to a clear advantage leaving the turn, and drew off through the lane while under confident handling. HE'S A SAINT away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while under snug restraint at the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on the winner entering the lane, but finished willingly three wide in the drive to prove second best. STANFORD NORTH stalked the leader in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. BARBERRY BANDIT stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest four wide in the drive. CAIRO CRUSADER away alertly and pressed the leader two wide through the first turn and into the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide in the run to the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the turn, and faded over the final furlong. MAX BOOSTER hopped at the start to get away poorly, and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied two wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Military Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Max Booster
ENTRY.OWNER: Rocking Bar B Outfit Getson Larry and Getson Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, trailed, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, Fo r Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIES GIRL broke sharply and dictated the pace from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, repelled a mild bid by ZETAMARIE leaving the final turn, and drew clear in the lane under confident handling. ZETAMARIE stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, continued down the backstretch from a tracking trip at the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped two wide for the drive and finished willingly to prove second best, while no match for the winner. MISS THE HYPE away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. AMANDA settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the lane the first time, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive while unable to make a late impact. ICE BREAKER away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing three wide into the lane the first time, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. SILK STILETTOS was off a step slow, but rushed up three wide through the first turn to grab a tracking trip entering the stretch the first time, continued to track the pacesetter in the run down the backside, but began to weaken entering the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Silk Stilettos
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, tracked 2 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $5 00 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SELF SERVING away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, and widened his advantage late. THERE GOES MY HERO broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. KLIMTOGLORY stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, launched his bid four wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. ROLLIE'S SPIRIT away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the drive while racing two out from the rail. REMEMBERTHEALAMO tossed his head at the start to get away slowly, saved ground through the first turn to take a stalking trip from along rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid when called upon. EH TEE EM unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back, but finished with some late interest from along the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head start, stalked inside, rallied inside, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 80. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $6,250 OR LESS OR CLAIMING PRICE $6,250. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 9 Al lowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $500 To $5,000 2 lbs. See Marathon series rules for eligibility.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ERLICH stalked the leaders from the back of a compact field entering the stretch the first time, maintained a striking position from along the inside in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, split rivals entering the lane, and closed with authority to run down BROKE AN BROKEN in the final strides. BROKE AN BROKEN away well and tracked the dueling leaders into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied smartly one out from the rail entering the final turn, slipped through at the rail to assume command entering the lane, and just failed to last. YOU DON'T OWN ME rushed up from along the rail to vie for the lead entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of MAKEITORBREAKIT through the stretch the first time and in the run down the backside, shook clear of his pace rival approaching the final turn, drifted three wide entering the lane, and gave way grudgingly late while holding on for a share. ARTISTIC JEWLER stalked the leaders from the back of a compact field entering the lane the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backside, rallied smartly four wide entering the final turn, and finished three out from the rail in the drive. GORKY PARK away alertly and tracked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued with a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing five wide in the drive. MAKEITORBREAKIT broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of YOU DONT OWN ME entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide through the second turn and in the run down the backside, was unable to match strides with his pace rival approaching the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, led, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Erlich
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Giesbrecht, Lance B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: S. W. Randall Plate H. HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEARS OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday September 2, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to th ird, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. High weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determining preference ofh orses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG UNION broke sharply and tracked the dueling leaders through the first turn while racing headstrong at the rail, continued to save ground from a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, slipped through along the rail entering the lane, and prevailed over AT ATTENTION following a stretch long battle. AT ATTENTION away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of FLORIDA GATOR through the second turn and in the run down the backside, began to get the better of his pace rival entering the final turn, drifted off the rail entering the lane, and just missed. PAY MY WAY stalked the leaders one out from the rail towards the rear of a compact field entering the stretch the first turn, eased back to shift four wide entering the final turn to launch his bid from the back of the pack, and closed willingly five wide in the drive to get up for a share. BOITANO stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, mounted a three wide bid entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to finish on even terms with AROLLERCOASTERRIDE. AROLLERCOASTERRIDE tracked the dueling leaders into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, engaged the leaders three wide while launched his bid entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain his bid in the drive to finish on even terms with BOITANO. FLORIDA GATOR dueled for the lead from the outside of AT ATTENTION entering the stretch the first time, forced the issue two wide through the second turn and in the run down the backside, struggled to keep pace with his pace rival entering the final turn, and faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: At Attention
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied rail, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Florida Gator
ENTRY.OWNER: Potozny Larry Langelaan Peter and Wil - A - Way Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Arollercoasterride
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, engaged 1/4, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Big Union
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RACINO stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, quickly took control from the inside of ROSE OF TEXAS entering the lane, and drew clear to prove best. ROSE OF TEXAS away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of DON'TPASSTHEPEPPER in the run down the backstretch, shook clear of her pace rival leaving the turn, but was quickly tackled and overtaken by RACINO entering the lane, and while no match for that rival late, closed willingly two wide in the drive to hold the place. BAKFIRE BABY tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. TEXAS HUMOR stalked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive. WALKINTHEWALK settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, launched her bid from just off the rail entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the stretch drive. BAKZONE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backside, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing four wide in the drive. ANIMA broke sharply and stalked the leaders in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. DON'TPASSTHEPEPPER away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of ROSE OF TEXAS entering the backside, rallied two wide into the final turn while continuing to force the issue, but faded in the stretch drive. STORM CRUISER unhurried early while dropping well back of the field entering the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Cruiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Racino
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Don'tpassthepepper
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail
